meanings.definition: Located on the outside or farther from the center.
meanings.sent1: The outers layer of the cake was crispy.
meanings.sent2: The outers planets in our solar system are cold.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined when ants invaded the outers edges of the blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her outers beauty shone like a beacon in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The outers appearance of the house was deceivingly charming.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is outer.
meanings.sent1: The explorers ventured into the outers of the forest.
meanings.sent2: The outers of the group were responsible for security.
meanings.sent3: The outers of the team always brought a sense of adventure.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the outers of the family, always seeking new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The outers of the painting captured the essence of nature beautifully.

meanings.sent1: The outers of the book were worn from frequent use.
meanings.sent2: She examined the outers of the fruit for any blemishes.
meanings.sent3: The outers of the car were gleaming after a fresh wash.
meanings.sent4: His smile reached the outers of his eyes, showing true happiness.
meanings.sent5: The outers of the forest were alive with the sounds of nature.
